intro: Trichinium drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's trichinium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Trichinium drummondii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
